text: Suicide presents major challenge public health United States globally . In 2021, total 48,183 persons (all ages) died suicide; suicide 11th leading cause death overall United States, accounting approximately 1.4% deaths . Although suicide suicidal behaviors public health concern life span, youths aged 1418 years present unique prevention challenges. Among high school-age youths aged 1418 years, 1,952 suicides occurred 2021, making suicide leading cause death age group (2021 rate = 9.0 100,000 population). Suicide accounted approximately fifth deaths (18.6%) age group . Deaths portion burden suicidal behavior; suicide attempts suicidal thoughts youths exceed deaths group. In 2020, according data nationally representative sample emergency departments (EDs), approximately 105,000 youths aged 1418 years visited EDs self-harm injuries .One main objectives Healthy People 2030 Mental Health Mental Disorders reduce suicide attempts youths . The Youth Risk Behavior Survey (YRBS) monitors categories priority health behaviors experiences high school students questions related suicide . This report summarizes 2021 YRBS data suicidal thoughts behaviors high school students compares results 2019; report updates previous analysis YRBS examining 20092019 data . The findings report indicate need comprehensive public health approach youth suicide prevention attention disproportionately affected populations.This report includes data 2019 (N = 13,677) 2021 (N = 17,232) YRBS, cross-sectional, school-based survey conducted biennially 1991. Each survey year, CDC collects data nationally representative sample public private school students grades 912 50 U.S. states District Columbia.
